Cucumber, Capsicum, Lentils

Vegan Mediterranean Lentil Salad

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup lentils (preferably green or brown for their texture)
  • 1 large cucumber, diced
  • 1 capsicum (bell pepper), color of your choice, diced
  • 1 small red onion, finely chopped (optional)
  • 1 garlic clove, minced (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons fresh mint, chopped (optional)
  • 1/4 cup olive oil
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon cumin powder (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Cook Lentils: Rinse the lentils and cook them according to package instructions until tender but not mushy. Drain and let cool.
  2. Prepare Vegetables: While the lentils are cooling, dice the cucumber, capsicum, and if using, the red onion. Chop the parsley and mint.
  3. Make Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, pepper, dried oregano, and cumin powder until well combined.
  4. Combine Salad: In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled lentils, diced cucumber, capsicum, red onion, parsley, and mint. If you're using cherry tomatoes, olives, or avocado, add them now.
  5. Dress & Season: Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently until everything is evenly coated. Taste and adjust the seasoning with more salt, pepper, or lemon juice as needed.
  6. Chill & Serve: For the best flavor, let the salad chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. This allows the flavors to meld together beautifully.

Quinoa, Avocado, Black Beans

Quinoa Avocado Black Bean Salad
Ingredients:
1 cup quinoa
2 avocados, diced
1 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
1 red bell pepper, diced
1/2 red onion, finely chopped
2 tablespoons cilantro, chopped
1 lime, juiced
1/4 cup olive oil
Salt and pepper, to taste
1 teaspoon chili powder (optional)
Instructions:
Cook Quinoa: Rinse the quinoa under cold water, then cook according to package instructions. Fluff with a fork and let cool.
Prepare Vegetables: While the quinoa is cooling, dice the avocado and red bell pepper, and finely chop the red onion and cilantro.
Combine Salad: In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, diced avocado, black beans, diced red bell pepper, chopped red onion, and cilantro.
Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and chili powder until well combined.
Dress & Mix: Pour the dressing over the salad and gently toss until everything is evenly coated.
Chill & Serve: Let the salad chill in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

Sweet Potato, Kale, Chickpeas

Roasted Sweet Potato and Kale Salad with Chickpeas
Ingredients:
2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 bunch of kale, stems removed and leaves torn
1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
2 tablespoons olive oil, divided
Salt and pepper, to taste
1 teaspoon smoked paprika
For the Dressing:
1/4 cup tahini
2 tablespoons maple syrup
2 tablespoons lemon juice
Water, as needed to thin
Instructions:
Roast Sweet Potatoes: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss sweet potatoes with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, pepper, and smoked paprika. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes, until tender.
Prepare Kale: While sweet potatoes are roasting, massage the kale with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil until the leaves start to soften.
Roast Chickpeas: Spread chickpeas on a baking sheet, season with salt and pepper, and roast in the oven for 15-20 minutes, until crispy.
Make Dressing: Whisk together tahini, maple syrup, lemon juice, and enough water to reach a pourable consistency. Season with salt to taste.
Assemble Salad: In a large bowl, combine roasted sweet potatoes, massaged kale, and crispy chickpeas. Drizzle with tahini dressing and toss to combine.
Serve: Enjoy this hearty salad warm or at room temperature.

Tofu, Spinach, Almonds

Spinach Almond Tofu Stir-Fry
Ingredients:
1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
2 cups spinach, washed and dried
1/2 cup almonds, roughly chopped
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 tablespoon soy sauce or tamari
1 tablespoon sesame oil
1 teaspoon ginger, grated
Salt and pepper, to taste
Instructions:
Prepare Tofu: Press the tofu to remove excess water, then cut into cubes.
Cook Tofu: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add tofu cubes and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
Sauté Spinach: In the same skillet, add a bit more olive oil if needed. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant. Add spinach and cook until just wilted.
Add Tofu & Almonds: Return the tofu to the skillet with the spinach. Add chopped almonds, soy sauce (or tamari), and sesame oil. Stir well to combine and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Season: Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.
Serve: Serve this nutritious stir-fry warm, perfect as a main dish or a hearty side.

Tomatoes, Basil, Pasta

Vegan Tomato Basil Pasta

Ingredients:

  • 8 ounces pasta (choose your favorite vegan variety)
  • 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved
  • 1/2 cup fresh basil, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
  • 1/4 cup nutritional yeast (for a cheesy flavor)

Instructions:

  1. Cook Pasta: Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside, reserving some pasta water.
  2. Sauté Tomatoes: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté for 1 minute. Add cherry tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Cook until tomatoes are soft, about 5 minutes.
  3. Combine: Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with tomatoes. Toss well to combine. If the mixture is too dry, add a little reserved pasta water.
  4. Finish & Serve: Stir in fresh basil and nutritional yeast. Adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve hot, garnished with more basil and nutritional yeast if desired.

Mushrooms, Garlic, Thyme

Garlic Thyme Mushrooms

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups mushrooms, sliced (any variety you prefer)
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped
  • Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:

  1. Heat Oil: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
  2. Sauté Garlic: Add the minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for about 1 minute, until fragrant but not browned.
  3. Add Mushrooms: Increase the heat to medium-high and add the mushrooms. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are golden brown and their liquid has evaporated, about 5-7 minutes.
  4. Season: Add the fresh thyme, salt, and pepper to the mushrooms. Stir well to combine and cook for another 2 minutes.
  5. Serve: Remove from heat and serve immediately. This dish makes a great side or can be served over cooked grains or pasta.

Carrots, Chickpeas, Cumin

Moroccan Carrot Chickpea Salad

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups carrots, grated
  • 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
  • 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
  • 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
  • 1/4 cup olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:

  1. Prepare Ingredients: In a large bowl, combine the grated carrots, chickpeas, chopped parsley, and cilantro.
  2. Make Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper until well combined.
  3. Combine & Chill: Pour the dressing over the carrot mixture and toss well to coat. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
  4. Serve: Adjust seasoning if necessary and serve chilled.

Beetroot, Walnut, Orange

Deconstructed Beetroot Walnut Orange Salad

Ingredients:

  • 3 medium beetroots, roasted and thinly sliced
  • 1/2 cup walnuts, toasted and crushed
  • 2 oranges, segmented and juice reserved
  • 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar reduction
  • 2 teaspoons orange zest
  • 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • Fresh mint leaves for garnish
  • Sea salt flakes and black pepper, to taste

Instructions:

  1. Beetroot Preparation: Wrap beetroots in foil and roast in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) until tender, about 1 hour. Once cooled, peel and slice thinly.
  2. Walnut Texture: Toast walnuts in a dry pan until fragrant, then lightly crush them, keeping some texture.
  3. Orange Components: Segment the oranges, being sure to reserve the juice. Mix the orange juice with balsamic reduction to create a dressing. Zest one of the oranges for garnish.
  4. Assembly: Arrange the beetroot slices on a plate, sprinkle with smoked paprika, and season with salt and pepper. Scatter the orange segments and crushed walnuts over the top.
  5. Dressing: Drizzle the orange-balsamic dressing over the salad. Garnish with orange zest and fresh mint leaves.
  6. Serve: This dish combines texture, taste, and aroma for a modern culinary experience. Enjoy immediately.

Squash, Sage, Pecans

Squash Sage Pecan Textural Contrast

Ingredients:

  • 1 butternut squash, peeled and cubed
  • 1/4 cup pecans, toasted and roughly chopped
  • 1 tablespoon fresh sage, finely chopped
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
  • Edible flowers for garnish (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Squash Preparation: Toss the cubed butternut squash with olive oil, sea salt, and black pepper. Roast in a preheated oven at 425°F (220°C) until tender and caramelized, about 25 minutes.
  2. Pecan Crunch: Toast pecans in a dry skillet until fragrant and lightly golden. Roughly chop to add texture.
  3. Sage Aroma: In the last 5 minutes of roasting, sprinkle the fresh sage over the squash to infuse it with aroma.
  4. Plating: Arrange the roasted squash on a serving plate. Drizzle with maple syrup for a glossy finish and sprinkle with the toasted pecans for crunch.
  5. Garnish: Add edible flowers for a pop of color and an extra layer of texture, if available.
  6. Serve: This dish is a celebration of autumn flavors with a balance of sweetness, nuttiness, and herbal notes, served with a modern twist.

Cauliflower, Almond Milk, Curry Powder

Cauliflower Almond Curry Espuma

Ingredients:

  • 1 large cauliflower, cut into florets
  • 2 cups almond milk
  • 1 tablespoon curry powder
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric
  • Sea salt and white pepper, to taste
  • Almond slivers, toasted, for garnish
  • Microgreens for garnish (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Cauliflower Puree: Steam the cauliflower florets until very tender. Blend in a high-speed blender with almond milk, curry powder, turmeric, salt, and white pepper until smooth.
  2. Strain: Pass the mixture through a fine sieve to ensure a silky texture.
  3. Espuma: Fill a siphon with the cauliflower mixture, charge with a cream charger, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
  4. Serve: Dispense the cauliflower curry espuma into small bowls or glasses. Garnish with toasted almond slivers and microgreens for a complex textural experience.
  5. Experience: This dish offers a modern culinary technique with traditional flavors, focusing on texture and presentation.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Tempeh, Arugula, Pomegranate

Asian Fusion Tempeh Salad with Arugula and Pomegranate

Ingredients:

  • 8 ounces tempeh, sliced and marinated in soy sauce, ginger, and garlic
  • 2 cups arugula
  • 1/2 cup pomegranate seeds
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted
  • 1 teaspoon grated ginger
  • 1 clove garlic, minced

Instructions:

  1. Marinate Tempeh: Combine soy sauce, grated ginger, and minced garlic in a bowl. Add tempeh slices and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  2. Cook Tempeh: In a skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Remove tempeh from the marinade (reserve the marinade) and cook until browned on both sides. Set aside.
  3. Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the reserved marinade, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and maple syrup to create the dressing.
  4. Assemble Salad: In a large bowl, toss arugula and pomegranate seeds with the dressing. Top with cooked tempeh slices and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.
  5. Serve: Enjoy this vibrant and flavorful salad as a unique blend of Asian and European influences.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Eggplant, Miso, Mozzarella

Miso Glazed Eggplant with Mozzarella

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium eggplants, sliced lengthwise
  • 2 tablespoons miso paste
  • 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup for vegan option
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon grated ginger
  • 1/2 cup shredded vegan mozzarella
  • Fresh basil leaves for garnish

Instructions:

  1. Miso Glaze: In a small bowl, mix together miso paste, honey/maple syrup, soy sauce, olive oil, garlic, and ginger to create a glaze.
  2. Prepare Eggplant: Brush each eggplant slice with the miso glaze. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  3. Roast: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) and roast the eggplant for 25-30 minutes, or until tender.
  4. Add Cheese: Sprinkle vegan mozzarella over the eggplant during the last 5 minutes of roasting, allowing it to melt.
  5. Garnish & Serve: Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving. This dish offers a delightful fusion of Japanese flavors with a touch of Italian flair.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Soba Noodles, Truffle Oil, Edamame

Truffled Soba Noodles with Edamame

Ingredients:

  • 8 ounces soba noodles
  • 1 cup edamame, shelled and cooked
  • 2 tablespoons truffle oil
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon grated ginger
  • Green onions, thinly sliced for garnish
  • Sesame seeds, for garnish

Instructions:

  1. Cook Soba Noodles: Cook soba noodles according to package instructions. Rinse under cold water and set aside.
  2. Dressing: In a small bowl, mix together truffle oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and grated ginger to create a dressing.
  3. Combine: In a large bowl, toss the soba noodles with the edamame. Pour over the dressing and mix until well combined.
  4. Garnish: Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
  5. Serve: This dish combines the earthy flavor of truffle oil with the nuttiness of soba noodles and the freshness of edamame, creating a sophisticated Asian-European fusion experience.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Roasted Eggplant, Shittake Mushroom, Corn

Homemade Vegan Gyoza with Miso Eggplant Filling

Ingredients:

  • Gyoza wrappers (vegan)
  • 1 medium eggplant, roasted and finely chopped
  • 1/2 cup shiitake mushrooms, finely chopped
  • 1/4 cup corn kernels
  • 1/2 cup wild broccoli, blanched and chopped
  • 1/2 cup spinach, blanched and chopped
  • 2 tablespoons shiro miso paste
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 1 inch piece of ginger, grated

Instructions:

  1. Mix Filling: In a large bowl, combine roasted eggplant, shiitake mushrooms, corn, wild broccoli, spinach, shiro miso paste, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger. Mix until well combined.
  2. Assemble Gyoza: Place a small spoonful of filling in the center of each gyoza wrapper. Wet the edges of the wrapper with water, fold in half, and press to seal, creating pleats.
  3. Cook Gyoza: Heat a non-stick pan with a bit of oil over medium heat. Place gyoza in the pan and cook until the bottom is golden brown. Add a small amount of water to the pan and cover with a lid. Steam until the gyoza are cooked through, about 5 minutes.
  4. Serve: Serve the gyoza hot with soy sauce or a dipping sauce of your choice.

King oyster mushrooms, cucumber, mint

Pulled Mushroom Bao with BBQ Hoisin Sauce

Ingredients:

  • 4 large king oyster mushrooms, shredded
  • 1/2 cup BBQ hoisin sauce
  • 4-6 bao buns
  • 1/2 cucumber, thinly sliced
  • Mint leaves
  • Cilantro leaves
  • 1/4 cup cashew nuts, roasted and crushed

Instructions:

  1. Cook Mushrooms: In a skillet, cook the shredded king oyster mushrooms with a bit of oil until they start to brown. Add BBQ hoisin sauce and cook until the mushrooms are well coated and the sauce has caramelized.
  2. Prepare Bao Buns: Steam the bao buns according to package instructions until soft and fluffy.
  3. Assemble: Open each bao bun and fill with the BBQ hoisin mushroom mixture. Add cucumber slices, mint leaves, and cilantro. Sprinkle with crushed cashew nuts.
  4. Serve: Serve immediately, offering a fusion of Asian flavors with the unique texture of pulled mushrooms.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
cucumber, tomato, mint

Crispy Shawarma Bao with Vegan Chicken

Ingredients:

  • 8 ounces planted chicken, cooked and shredded
  • 4-6 bao buns
  • 1/2 cucumber, diced
  • 1 tomato, diced
  • 1/2 cup vegan feta, crumbled
  • Mint leaves for garnish
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
  • 2 tablespoons shawarma seasoning

Instructions:

  1. Season Chicken: Toss the cooked and shredded planted chicken with shawarma seasoning.
  2. Cook Chicken: In a pan, lightly sauté the seasoned chicken until crispy and heated through.
  3. Prepare Bao Buns: Steam the bao buns according to package instructions until soft and fluffy.
  4. Assemble: Open each bao bun and fill with the crispy shawarma chicken. Add cucumber, tomato, and crumbled vegan feta. Garnish with mint leaves and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
  5. Serve: Enjoy this Middle Eastern-inspired dish with the soft texture of bao buns and the rich flavors of vegan shawarma.

Cauliflower, Sesame

Tandoori Cauliflower Dumplings

Ingredients:

  • 1 head cauliflower, cut into small florets
  • 2 tablespoons tandoori seasoning
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, plus more for garnish
  • 1 cup all-purpose flour (for vegan dumpling dough)
  • Water, as needed for dough
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • Oil for frying

Instructions:

  1. Prepare Cauliflower: Toss cauliflower florets with tandoori seasoning and let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  2. Make Dumpling Dough: Mix all-purpose flour, sesame seeds, salt, and enough water to form a smooth dough. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
  3. Fill Dumplings: Take small portions of dough and roll them out into circles. Place a few marinated cauliflower florets in the center of each circle, fold the dough over the filling, and seal the edges to form dumplings.
  4. Cook Dumplings: Heat oil in a deep fryer or pan. Fry the dumplings until golden brown and crispy.
  5. Serve: Garnish with sesame seeds and serve hot with a side of mint yogurt or tandoori sauce for dipping.

Soy based burgers, Avocado, Quinoa

Quinoa-Stuffed Soy Burgers with Avocado

Ingredients:

  • 4 soy-based burger patties
  • 1 avocado, sliced
  • 1 cup cooked quinoa
  • 1/4 cup diced red onion
  • 1/4 cup chopped cilantro
  • 2 tablespoons lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 4 whole grain burger buns
  • Optional toppings: lettuce, tomato, vegan mayo

Instructions:

  1. Prepare Quinoa Mixture: In a bowl, mix together cooked quinoa, diced red onion, chopped cilantro, lime juice, and season with salt and pepper.
  2. Cook Burgers: Grill or pan-fry the soy-based burgers according to package instructions until they are thoroughly cooked.
  3. Assemble Burgers: Place each burger on a whole grain bun. Top with a generous spoonful of the quinoa mixture and a few slices of avocado. Add any additional toppings as desired.
  4. Serve: Enjoy your quinoa-stuffed soy burgers with a side of sweet potato fries or a fresh salad for a complete meal.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Plant based sausages, Bell peppers, Pineapple

Tropical Plant-Based Sausage Skewers

Ingredients:

  • 4 plant-based sausages, cut into chunks
  • 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
  • 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks
  • 1 cup pineapple chunks
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Skewers (if using wooden skewers, soak in water for 30 minutes prior to use)

Instructions:

  1. Marinade: In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, soy sauce, minced garlic, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Add the plant-based sausage chunks, bell pepper chunks, and pineapple. Toss to coat and let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  2. Assemble Skewers: Thread the marinated sausage, bell peppers, and pineapple chunks onto the skewers alternately.
  3. Cook: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill skewers, turning occasionally, until the sausages are heated through and the vegetables and pineapple are slightly charred, about 10-15 minutes.
  4. Serve: Enjoy your tropical plant-based sausage skewers over a bed of rice or with a fresh salad for a light and satisfying meal.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Beyond Meat substitutes, Sweet potato, Kale

Sweet Potato and Kale Stuffed Beyond Meat Loaf

Ingredients:

  • 1 pound Beyond Meat ground substitute
  • 1 large sweet potato, peeled and finely diced
  • 2 cups kale, chopped and steamed
  • 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1/4 cup plant-based milk
  • 1 small onion, diced
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Optional glaze: 2 tablespoons ketchup mixed with 1 tablespoon maple syrup and 1 teaspoon soy sauce

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
  2. Sauté Sweet Potato and Kale: In a skillet, heat a little oil and sauté the sweet potato, kale, onion, and garlic until the sweet potatoes are soft and the kale is wilted. Set aside to cool slightly.
  3. Mix: In a large bowl, combine the Beyond Meat ground substitute, cooked sweet potato and kale mixture, breadcrumbs, plant-based milk, tomato paste, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
  4. Form Loaf: Transfer the mixture to a loaf pan lined with parchment paper. Press down to compact the mixture.
  5. Add Glaze: If using, brush the top of the loaf with the optional glaze mixture.
  6. Bake: Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the loaf is firm and the top is slightly caramelized.
  7. Rest: Let the loaf rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
  8. Serve: Serve slices of the stuffed Beyond Meat loaf with extra ketchup or your favorite vegan gravy. This hearty dish pairs well with roasted vegetables or a simple green salad.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Chickpeas, Spinach, Coconut Milk

Mediterranean-Asian Fusion Chickpea Spinach Stew

Ingredients:

  • 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
  • 2 cups spinach, washed and chopped
  • 1 can coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon curry powder
  • 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
  • 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh cilantro, chopped for garnish
  • Warm flatbread, for serving

Instructions:

  1. Heat Olive Oil: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and toast until fragrant.
  2. Sauté Vegetables: Add the diced onion and minced garlic, sautéing until the onion is translucent.
  3. Spice it Up: Stir in curry powder and turmeric, cooking for another minute until the spices are well combined with the onion and garlic.
  4. Add Chickpeas: Mix in the chickpeas, ensuring they are coated with the spice mixture.
  5. Pour in Coconut Milk: Add the coconut milk and bring the mixture to a simmer. Let cook for about 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
  6. Wilt Spinach: Add the chopped spinach, cooking until just wilted.
  7. Season: Finish the stew with lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.
  8. Garnish & Serve: Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with warm flatbread on the side.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Tofu, Bok Choy, Sesame Seeds

Sesame Crusted Tofu with Bok Choy

Ingredients:

  • 1 block firm tofu, pressed and sliced
  • 2 heads bok choy, chopped
  • 3 tablespoons sesame seeds
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon grated ginger
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Lemon wedges, for serving

Instructions:

  1. Prepare Tofu: Coat the tofu slices with sesame seeds, pressing them in to adhere on both sides.
  2. Cook Tofu: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the tofu slices and cook until golden and crispy on each side. Remove from the pan and set aside.
  3. Sauté Bok Choy: In the same pan, add sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute before adding the bok choy. Cook until the bok choy is wilted but still crisp.
  4. Season: Drizzle soy sauce over the bok choy and season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine.
  5. Serve: Arrange the sesame crusted tofu over the bok choy. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.

Eggplant, Tomato Paste, Basil

Asian-Inspired Eggplant Basil Stir-Fry

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium eggplants, cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon chili flakes (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • Salt to taste
  • Toasted sesame seeds, for garnish

Instructions:

  1. Heat Oil: In a large skillet or wok, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
  2. Add Eggplant: Increase the heat to high and add the eggplant pieces. Cook, stirring frequently, until the eggplant starts to soften and brown.
  3. Tomato Mixture: In a small bowl, mix together tomato paste, soy sauce, maple syrup, rice vinegar, and chili flakes. Pour this mixture over the eggplant and stir to coat evenly.
  4. Cook: Continue to cook on high heat until the eggplant is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
  5. Add Basil: Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil leaves.
  6. Garnish & Serve: Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the top before serving. This dish pairs well with steamed rice or noodles.

Miso, Shiitake Mushrooms, Noodles

Miso Shiitake Mushroom Noodle Soup

Ingredients:

  • 8 ounces noodles (such as soba or udon)
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 tablespoons miso paste (white or red)
  • 1 cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
  • Green onions, sliced for garnish
  • Optional: tofu cubes, baby spinach, or bok choy for added nutrition

Instructions:

  1. Cook Noodles: Cook the noodles according to package instructions, drain, and set aside.
  2. Sauté Mushrooms: In a large pot, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add garlic, ginger, and shiitake mushrooms. Sauté until the mushrooms are soft.
  3. Prepare Miso Broth: In a small bowl, mix miso paste with a little hot vegetable broth until smooth. Add this mixture to the pot along with the rest of the broth and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer but do not boil to preserve the miso’s flavor.
  4. Combine: Add the cooked noodles to the pot. If using, add tofu, baby spinach, or bok choy and cook until just wilted.
  5. Serve: Garnish with sliced green onions before serving. Enjoy this comforting bowl of miso shiitake mushroom noodle soup.

Rice, Kimchi, Seaweed

Kimchi Fried Rice with Seaweed

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups cooked rice, preferably day-old
  • 1 cup kimchi, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons kimchi juice
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • 1/2 cup diced vegetables (such as carrots, peas, or bell peppers)
  • 2 sheets nori seaweed, shredded
  • Optional toppings: sliced green onions, sesame seeds, cucumber slices

Instructions:

  1. Heat Sesame Oil: In a large skillet or wok, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and diced vegetables. Sauté until the vegetables are soft.
  2. Add Kimchi: Increase the heat to high and add the chopped kimchi, frying until it starts to crisp at the edges.
  3. Mix in Rice: Add the cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any clumps. Stir-fry, ensuring the rice gets fully coated with the kimchi and vegetable mixture.
  4. Season: Pour in the kimchi juice and soy sauce, mixing well. Cook for a few more minutes until everything is hot and the rice has absorbed the flavors.
  5. Serve: Remove from heat and stir in the shredded nori seaweed. Serve hot, garnished with optional toppings like green onions, sesame seeds, and cucumber slices.

  • Fresh parsley, chopped for garnish

  • Fresh parsley, chopped

  • Coconut milk

Sweet Potato Kale Coconut Stew

  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Water or vegetable broth, as needed
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish
  • Chili flakes for garnish (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Sauté Onions and Garlic: In a large pot, heat the sesame oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, sautéing until the onion is translucent.
  2. Add Sweet Potato: Incorporate the sweet potato cubes and curry powder, stirring to coat the sweet potatoes in the spices. Cook for about 2 minutes.
  3. Pour in Coconut Milk: Add the coconut milk and enough water or vegetable broth to cover the sweet potatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer.
  4. Cook: Let the stew simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
  5. Add Kale: Stir in the kale and soy sauce, cooking until the kale has wilted.
  6. Season: Adjust the seasoning with salt, pepper, and more soy sauce if needed.

Pumpkin Feta Dumplings with Scallion Soy Dip

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup vegan feta cheese, crumbled
  • 1/4 cup scallions, finely chopped
  • Dumpling wrappers (vegan)
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • For Scallion Soy Dip:
  • 1/4 cup soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1/4 cup scallions, chopped
  • 1 teaspoon sugar
  • Chili flakes (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Mix Filling: Combine mashed pumpkin, crumbled feta cheese, chopped scallions, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  2. Assemble Dumplings: Place a teaspoon of the filling in the center of each dumpling wrapper. Wet the edges of the wrapper with water, fold in half, and press to seal, creating pleats.
  3. Cook Dumplings: Steam the dumplings for about 10-12 minutes or until translucent and cooked through. Alternatively, you can pan-fry them for a crispy texture.
  4. Prepare Dip: For the scallion soy dip, mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, chopped scallions, sugar, and chili flakes in a bowl. Stir well until the sugar dissolves.
  5. Serve: Arrange dumplings on a serving plate with the scallion soy dip on the side. Enjoy your fusion of European and Asian flavors in one bite!

Vegan Avocado Tofu Mango Salsa Tacos

Ingredients:

  • 1 ripe avocado, diced
  • 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
  • 1 ripe mango, diced
  • 1 small red onion, finely chopped
  • 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
  • 1 lime, juiced
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 6 small corn tortillas

Instructions:

  1. Prepare Tofu: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Add cubed tofu and gently toss to coat. Let marinate for 15 minutes.
  2. Cook Tofu: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook until all sides are golden brown, about 5-7 minutes. Set aside.
  3. Make Mango Salsa: In a mixing bowl, combine diced mango, avocado, red onion, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix gently.
  4. Warm Tortillas: Warm the corn tortillas in a pan over medium heat for about 30 seconds on each side or until they are soft and pliable.
  5. Assemble Tacos: Place a generous amount of tofu on each tortilla, top with mango avocado salsa, and if desired, add slices of jalapeno and a dollop of vegan sour cream.

Ingredients:

  • 1 garlic clove, minced (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons fresh mint, chopped (optional)
  • 1/4 cup olive oil
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon cumin powder (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Cook Lentils: Rinse the lentils and cook them according to package instructions until tender but not mushy. Drain and let cool.
  2. Prepare Vegetables: While the lentils are cooling, dice the cucumber, capsicum, and if using, the red onion. Chop the parsley and mint.
  3. Make Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, pepper, dried oregano, and cumin powder until well combined.
  4. Combine Salad: In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled lentils, diced cucumber, capsicum, red onion, parsley, and mint. If you're using cherry tomatoes, olives, or avocado, add them now.
  5. Dress & Season: Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently until everything is evenly coated. Taste and adjust the seasoning with more salt, pepper, or lemon juice as needed.
  6. Chill & Serve: For the best flavor, let the salad chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. This allows the flavors to meld together beautifully.

  1. Marinate Tofu: In a bowl, whisk together agave syrup, soy sauce, lime juice, chili powder, garlic powder, and smoked paprika. Add tofu cubes and marinate for at least 30 minutes, preferably longer for deeper flavor.
  2. Cook Tofu: Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated tofu and cook until all sides are golden brown and crispy, about 8-10 minutes. Occasionally turn the cubes for even cooking.
  3. Prepare Tacos: Warm the corn tortillas on a pan or directly over the flame for a few seconds on each side.

Asian Fusion Corn & Black Bean Tacos

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups corn kernels (fresh or grilled for extra flavor)
  • 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 1 red bell pepper, diced
  • 1 green bell pepper, diced
  • 1/2 cup red cabbage, thinly sliced
  • 2 green onions, chopped
  • 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon sriracha or to taste
  • 1 tablespoon agave syrup
  • Small corn tortillas
  • Sesame seeds, for garnish
  • Lime wedges, for serving

Instructions:

  1. Prepare Filling: In a large bowl, combine corn, black beans, red and green bell peppers, red cabbage, and green onions.
  2. Make Asian Fusion Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sriracha, and agave syrup until well combined.
  3. Dress Filling: Pour the dressing over the corn mixture and toss until everything is evenly coated. Let sit for at least 10 minutes to marinate.
  4. Warm Tortillas: Heat the corn tortillas in a dry pan over medium heat or directly over a flame for a few seconds on each side until warm and slightly charred.
  5. Assemble Tacos: Spoon the corn and black bean mixture into the warm tortillas. Garnish with chopped cilantro and sesame seeds.
  6. Serve: Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the tacos.

you are an Cooking Assistant specialising in vegan recipes. your cooking style is mediterranean asian fusion, similar to a mix between Jamie Oliver and Joanne Molinaro. You  will be given a set of ingredients and respond with a great tasting recipe involving those ingredients.
Mango, Coconut Milk, Rice Flour

Mango Coconut Sticky Rice Pudding

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup glutinous rice flour
  • 2 ripe mangos, peeled and sliced
  • 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
  • 1/2 cup water
  • 1/2 cup sugar
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted (for garnish)
  • Mint leaves (for garnish)

Instructions:

  1. Make Sticky Rice Dough: In a bowl, mix glutinous rice flour with water until it forms a smooth dough. Roll into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
  2. Cook Sticky Rice Balls: Bring a pot of water to boil. Add the rice balls and cook until they float to the surface, about 3-5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
  3. Prepare Coconut Sauce: In a saucepan, combine coconut milk, sugar, and salt. Heat over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Do not boil.
  4. Combine: Add the cooked sticky rice balls to the coconut sauce and gently mix to coat.
  5. Serve: Place a generous amount of sliced mango on each serving plate. Spoon the sticky rice balls and coconut sauce over the mango. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and mint leaves.
  6. Chill & Serve: For the best flavor, chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. This dessert can be served cold or at room temperature.
